de.mrapp.android.view

Class FloatingActionButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelativeLayout
      • de.mrapp.android.view.FloatingActionButton

  • public class FloatingActionButton
extends RelativeLayout
    A floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines. Refer to http://www.google.com/design/spec/components/buttons-floating-action- button.html for further information on the Material design guidelines.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FloatingActionButton.Size
      Contains all possible sizes of a floating action button.

      • FloatingActionButton

        public FloatingActionButton(Context context,
                            AttributeSet attributeSet,
                            @StyleRes
                            int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • FloatingActionButton

        public FloatingActionButton(Context context,
                            AttributeSet attributeSet,
                            @StyleRes
                            int defaultStyle,
                            int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the view, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public final FloatingActionButton.Size getSize()
        Returns the floating action button's size.
        Returns:
        The floating action button's size as a value of the enum FloatingActionButton.Size. The size may either be NORMAL or SMALL

        Parameters:

      • getVisibilityAnimationDuration

        public final long getVisibilityAnimationDuration()
        Returns the duration of the animation, which may be used to change the visibility of the floating action button.
        Returns:
        The duration of the animation in milliseconds as a Long value

      • setVisibilityAnimationDuration

        public final void setVisibilityAnimationDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration of the animation, which may be used to change the visibility of the floating action button.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration, which should be set, in milliseconds as a Long value

      • setVisibility

        public final void setVisibility(int visibility,
                                boolean animate)
        Sets the visibility of the floating action button.
        Parameters:
        visibility - The visibility, which should be set, as an Integer value. The visibility may be View.VISIBLE, View.INVISIBLE or View.GONE
        animate - True, if changing the visibility should be animated, false otherwise
